item.title: KFF Health News' 'What the Health?': Chaos Continues in Federal Health System
item.description: The Senate has yet to confirm a Health and Human Services secretary, but things around the department continue to change at a breakneck pace to comply...

item.title: Officials Seek To Dismantle Appeals Board for Montanans Denied Public Assistance
item.description: The Montana health department says the Board of Public Assistance is redundant and a bureaucratic hurdle that helps few people. Current and former boa...

item.title: Biden Rule Cleared Hurdles to Lifesaving HIV Drug, but in Georgia Barriers Remain
item.description: A new rule requires insurers to improve coverage of PrEP, which can prevent HIV, but Georgians face challenges getting the drug.

item.title: California Housing Officials Recommend State Protect Renters From Extreme Heat
item.description: State officials say homes should be able to be cooled to a safe indoor air temperature of 82 degrees. The legislature will now take up the report.

item.title: Funcionarios de California recomiendan que el estado proteja a los inquilinos del calor extremo
item.description: Aunque la mayoría de las muertes y enfermedades causadas por el calor se pueden prevenir, alrededor de 1.220 personas mueren cada año en el país por e...
